location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 5: James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, Temporarily in Charge of the Residency, Bushire, to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: In this letter James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, temporarily in charge of the Residency, acknowledges the receipt of Government commands dated 9 May, together with a copy of a letter addressed to His Majesty's Chargé d’Affaires at the Court of Tehran, Henry Willock. In response, Dow reports that the ship, the Francis Warden, reached Bushire on 4 August and that the packages intended for His Majesty the Shah of Persia [Fat'h Ali Shah Qajar] have been safely landed at the Residency, where they will remain until instructions are received from His Majesty's Chargé d’Affaires.
